alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 22 at 10:31AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... the desert slopes of the San Diego County mountains into the San Diego County Deserts... * Until 1245 PM PST. * At 1031 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 0.2 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Mount Laguna, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Borrego Springs, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente and Fish Creek Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
